info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 30 at 3:01PM EDT until June 30 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Northern Indiana
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of southwest Michigan, including the following county, Hillsdale and northwest Ohio, including the following county, Williams.
* WHEN...Until 500 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 259 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain has fallen in the last hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pioneer, Columbia, Camden, Lake Seneca, Nettle Lake and Bridgewater Center. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON
